result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackenzie Jeron Moore

records.addlTxt: for Examination under 971.16 ( Not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect), signed and filed.
Defense counsel request a NGI Examination  Order for NGI Examination

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Mackenzie Jeron Moore.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 8 pages) commencing 10-04-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Mackenzie Jeron Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Correctional Officer G. Kohl.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Arraignment scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel does not appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Court ordered defendant kept separate for alleged victim AAD (5.18.1958) while in custody.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mackenzie Jeron Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
